This link works if you want the clients to discover the server. But if you want to just know, whenever you start your app, all the versions of app running regardless of whether they are clients or servers. Youll have to start the discovery server on each app on a certain port. Whenever a new app is started, it should do the following : it will start another udp server and save its port, and will send a broadcast on a certain port saying "hey, if anyone is hearing me, please let me know on myaddress:myport". It then collects the responses for a while and continues to do whatever it's supposed to do.

i developed my android remote control app "Aio Remote" with raw TCP and UDP but for the part of discovery for simplicity I used liberary called "Kryonet". it is just one line and reliable for me. but i use it to discover 1 device. didnt try it with multiple devices
